abstract: A new technology from Intel called Light Peak could increase data transmission speeds inside a PC by a factor of 20 and eliminate the need for most of the device connectors found on today’s machines.
snippet: A new technology from Intel called Light Peak could increase data transmission speeds inside a PC by a factor of 20 and eliminate the need for most of the device connectors found on today’s machines.
lead_paragraph: Are you still waiting for that “last mile” of fiber optic cable to reach your home? It could reach your laptop first.

headline.main: Shuttling PC Data at the Speed of Light
